course_description: This seminar will introduce key issues, policies, and doctrines on corporate criminality, enforcement, and compliance. Topics of study will include (1) the nature of corporate criminal liability, (2) the rights of the corporation as defendant, (3) substantive offenses that often lead to corporate criminal enforcement, (4) the contemporary practice of corporate criminal law, (5) sanctioning practices and sentencing policies for corporate offenders, (6) the intersection of corporate crime and corporate compliance, and (7) comparative corporate criminal law in non-U.S. jurisdictions.
